reviews.review: Very fun game, not too long. Amazing storyline and if you get lucky, you can pick it up for $10 on a sale.
It's just an awesome game. 10/10

Easily one of the best stories in a game I've ever played. Characters are memorable (especially the twins) and feel real, changing, and alive. Gunplay is fantastic (I feel like I want to use the pistol for the whole game, it feels great). The only criticism I have is that oftentimes the combat actually takes away from the story somewhat. There were moments where I just thought "Get the enemies out, I don't care! Tell me more things!" Also the Boys of Silence are f***ing terrifying and, if you've played it, you know exactly where I screamed.
9/10

Confession time... I played through and hated both BioShock 1 and 2. I felt like there was blood and gore for the sake of having blood and gore. Not because it helped with my emersion. But now, with Infinite I am blown away. I loved this game. When I heard it was coming out I groaned for another "Gore-fest" so I thought that I'd watch a Let's play to see if my suspisions were going to be validated. But after seeing Jesse Cox play though the first 20 minutes or so my mind was changed. 

This is a fantastic game, much better than its two older brothers. Little Sisters? 

Great Game!

Look here.  People go crazy over this game for a reason.  It's amazing.  It's incredible.  You'll wonder how you ever lived without playing it.  It's one of the best games of all time, and more than lives up to the Bioshock name.  Play the game, feel the magic, have some fun.

Bioshock Infinite, hat mich wirklich überrascht. Ich habe selten einen Shooter gespielt, der so ein Detailreichtum besitzt wie dieses Spiel. Man möchte quasi an jeder Ecke stehen bleiben und sich die Dialoge der NPC's anhören und sich die Welt angucken. Die durchgehende Story lässt einen zu keinem Zeitpunkt und hat ein verblüffendes Ende. 
Dieses Spiel sitzu mepfehlen.

Played many games from BioShiock and this one take the cake. The Soundtrack the gameplay the setting the story, everything. Amazing thing is I havent even finsihed it. Bought the Season Pass as to get all the DLC and glad I did! The Blinged out Pistol makes the game all the more epic. Big props for choosing Mozarts' Reqium; Lacrimosa! Huge Mozart fan and it fits so well. Truely an awesome experiance for gamers. 
Many Thanks

Далеко не каждый день выходит игра, в которой отточены абсолютно все механики, и где каждый художественный элемент работает на атмосферу. Bioshock Infinite - именно такой проект. Использование оружия и энергетиков в бою, взаимодействие с окружающим миром (аэротрассы и разрывы дарят полностью новый для шутера опыт), внешний вид персонажей и самого летающего города, звуки и музыка (хоровое пение из пролога - это что-то с чем-то!) - всё отполировано до блеска и выполнено на  высочайшем уровне. Но главные бриллианты Bioshock Infinite - это, конечно, Элизабет, неординарный сюжет и грандиозный финал.

Okay i love Bioshock but if you watched the first demo ever day till the second demo came out then watched both till the game was released you will be upset. All in all the levels are tiny compared to the first two demo's also the background builds are 1 low res or 2 a 2D cut out it's a real deal breaker and then we where told all the building where unscripted so at anytime any building could fall out the sky that was cut the boys of silence where downgraded. The multiplayer was cut then the levels where sold to us in the Clash In The Clouds DLC. Then the hole story has been changed 3 times. Also from the second Demo there are posters of a different comstock if you no clip left in the retail version here
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S5KTI_S0Tg4

It's like a nicely covered up duke nukem if you dig around you will dislike this game more and more and you will find out what it was going to be. Look google Bioshock concept and behold everthing that was cut most of it mindblowing but all we got was mediocore. Here i will uncover 1 of the many cover ups the handymen We where told they where a tragic creature and we would have it explain and shown why. With that in mind you would think in game you would expect a level where there getting made and be sicking like seeing people getting put into the handyen suits but no.

Как произведение искусства BioShock Infinite удовлетворяет самую старую и самую главную потребность человека — чтобы ему рассказали интересную историю.
Infinite поражает не бюджетом, суперпродвинутыми технологиями, ставящими на колени мощнейшие видеокарты или заковыристой смесью жанров. Хотя, здесь есть и бюджет в 100 миллионов и превосходная графика. Главная особенность - история, мастерски рассказанная и продуманная до мелочей, приковывает к экрану и не отпускает до самого финала с титрами. Глубина персонажей и продуманность мира вокруг вас заставляет поверить во все происходящее на экране уже с первых минут игры. А постоянная недосказанность пробуждает в глубине вас интерес: "А что же дальше? Что там за углом?".
Ну и, конечно же, прекрасная Элизабет. Она — квинтэссенция невинности и красоты. Ею нельзя не умиляться — это диснеевская принцесса, волшебное существо из мира фантазий. Ей нельзя не сопереживать, ведь повсюду ужасы войны. А она во многом обычная девушка — мечтает побывать в Париже, любит танцевать, умеет разламывать пространство и время. Очень трогательно хмурит брови, когда злится; трогательно бросается книгами, воздушными шариками, товарняками и уличными оркестрами. Такой персонаж встречается редко, очень редко — она такая одна на миллион.
Любите приключения, захватывающие истории и по-настоящему хорошие игры – не пропустите одну из них!

Very pretty game with an interesting story, and my praise ends there.

 This game oversimplifies the mechanics of the first two BioShock games, removing a lot of features entirely.  Vigors are a dumbed-down version of Plasmids that are not tangential to the plot of the game like Plasmids were to BioShock (though this is cheaply tied together in the last DLC).  Hacking is gone entirely.  Tonics have been replaced with a much smaller variety of equipable clothing.  Vending machines are horrendously expensive.  Skylines are pretty silly for methodically dispatching most enemies at ease.  The game also treats the player with an innovative and never-before-seen regenerating shield on top of their standard health bar.

Does not have the same sense of wonder and discovery of the previous games, mostly because Infinite is, dare I say, a completely different genre from the other BioShock games - it's an action FPS, and as far as I am concerned, the only thing that makes it remotely similar to BioShock is a brief tie-in with Rapture, and "BIOSHOCK:" being in the title of the game.

I'd recommend it for a $10 Steam sale, not much more than that.  The Burial at Sea DLC brings you back to Rapture in the most awful way possible - playing with the same terrible, console-treated mechanics that you had to deal with in the main campaign of Infinite.  UPDATE 3/25/14:  BoS Episode 2 does a little better in this regard, forcing the player to adopt a stealthier style of play unlike the running and gunning of Infinite and DLC 1.

I honestly don't get the critical circlejerk about this game.  It is easily the least fun entry in the series.  For reference, I had played the first and second BioShock games within a period of 72 hours prior to playing Infinite.

Update 3/25/14:  Burial at Sea Episode 2 fills a lot of holes and ties a lot of plotlines together, almost to the point where it feels like filling plotholes was the only reason this DLC was created.  Nevertheless, playing as Elizabeth is a lot more interesting than Booker's chapter of the Rapture DLC, and the storyline of the second episode is a lot more important than the first.  Considering that the second DLC offers a "recap" of Booker's DLC, only purchasing Episode 2 is entirely feasible.

BIoshock Infinite... where to begin?

The story of Bioshock is one that we all have come to love. The first game was memoriable not because of the new gameplay elements it introducted with plasma, but because the story was so gripping. I played that game in ONE SITTING because i was so into the game. It was one of the only games that i have every done that with. 
Bioshock 2 takes place 8 years after the first but left a hole in the plot and was almost a copy and paste version of the first.

Now Bioshock Infinite comes out.
Bioshock Infinite may not offer the newest shooting elements, nor will it win any awards for the multiplayer, but this game stands out as a TRUE sequel to the first Bioshock. The characters, the story, the enviroment, everything stands out just like it did in the first Bioshock. 
It starts with Booker DeWitt and he is searching for a woman named Elizabeth. The reasoning behind this is vague,cloudy and adds to the development of the story. "Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt". Columbia feels different than Rapture...yet strangely familiar. You will be impressed looking around just as you did with the first Bioshock.

Columbia's world sucks you straight in and never let's up. I was surprised to see countless themes put into this new world. Racism, Social Class System, Socialism, War, Rebellion, Revolt, everything that was found in the early 20th Century.
Some people might be turned off because of the "religious" theme that is found throughout the story, but believe me it does not turn the story off. 

i HIGHELY RECOMMEND that you search for all the VOXOPHONES to get the entire story of Bioshock Infinite.

The graphics in Bioshock Infinite are right up there with some of the best and  current PC games. Whether it comes to a keyboard or a controller the controls are tight and responsive either way. Take the time to look around and see the detail and hidden secrets that the world of Columbia has to offer. This is probably my GOT for 2013.

I look forward to the newest installment of Bioshock through DLC and maybe a sequel? Who Knows?
10/10

It was a brilliant story (until the ending), but the gameplay was mediocre.  The concept of tears was brilliant, but the skyhook idea was outright stupid.  Next to no replayability as opposed to the original Bioshock, which I go back through at least annually.  The only reason I havent uninstalled it yet is that I'm waiting for the Season Pass to go on sale.  But I will probably never play the base game again.  Glad I waited for the Autumn Sale to get it for $10 instead of wasting $60 on it at release.

EDIT:   Went back to play it through like eight years later and it's buggy as HELL.  Seems to be a common problem, getting to Finktown and the game just lags out at some point soon after rescuing Chen Lin.  Unplayably broken, and has been for years, to judge by google searches.

Simply put, this is my game of the year 2013. Nothing else I played this year manages to combine a breathtaking yet forbidding environment that made me feel wonder and horror at the same time. Added to that, challenging combat that forced me to think about all the resources available to and around me and the best way of deploying them. And last but not least, a compelling and engaging story told between fascinating characters and presented as only how a FPS can pull off.
A masterpiece of storytelling, and production design. Get it! :)

The story of Bioshock: Infinite is one of the best I have ever seen in a video game. The concept is mind-blowing, yet executed in the game so smoothly and thoroughly. You will really appreciate the idea once you have finished a second playthrough like I did. Everything just fits, and the ending is just so thought-provoking and satisfying that maybe it sticks in your mind for a few days. If you enjoy movies like Inception or Matrix, I believe you will definitely enjoy this game.

The game world is phenomenal, set in an extreme nationalistic religious society that somehow reminds me of Animal Farm and the Civil War. It is illustrated in a radiant art style that makes you stop every now and then to contemplate the scenery.

The gameplay is ok, but it's not the best shooter (I think that VGX award is a joke). It is enjoyable despite a few flaws. You have your guns in one hand and "magic" in another, combining them to blow your enemies' heads off. The battle environment is also interesting, allowing variable strategy to tackle the situation. At least it will not feel repetitive unless you are about to run a fifth playthrough.

Oh one more thing, you will love Elizabeth like I do. She has a charming character, designed with amazing AI, and gradually you start to really care for her. Her relationship with Booker, depicted in some cutscenes will probably put tears in your eyes.

In conclusion, B:I has an amazing story with solid (but not ground-breaking) gameplay. It deserves every praise it has received. Go buy it, worth every cent.

Я просто рекомендую всем эту игру.

BioShock Infinite is one of the newer FPS games with a twist of special powers and a pretty face to protect. Initial feel was very wrong, but it all turns better once your first skull in. The gore was actually quite suprising after the first steps in this religious utopia.

The Graphics and special effects in Bioshock Infinite leave no room for complainment and you often find yourself in a glorious battle with lots of fire and lightning blazing around you. The Weapons have a real feel to them. Even the basic pistol really makes a dent in combat as long as you aim between the eyes (unlike in Bioshock 1). Combining a headshot with a salt power makes feel like a Fallout character with the legendary Bloody Mess perk picked.  All of the weapons and your special powers are upgradable and you can even dress up with items that suit your playing style best.

The movement controls have a great feel to them letting move, run and crawl and jump without any depressing delays. It's better than in FEAR 3 example, which had quite good controls too. The feel of control is only hindered by sight centering when you are jumping on a sky rail, hitting some invisible walls and getting stuck in textures just when you thought you found the perfect shortcut.

Mini bosses in the early game are great, but I have to give a huge minus because of the handymen later on. There is nothing more depressing then huge enemies that will only drain your ammo. It's like fighting the super mutants from FarCry 1. The only difference is that you can't skip them in Bioshock Infinite. You simply have to take em out before continuing on.

Voice acting is quite solid, especially by Courtnee Draper (Elizabeth). The Environment is decent enough. If you like Noir, you will propably love it. While you mostly roll in an sky urban setting, you will find yourself fighting in less generic places like a cemetary or a bank vault from time to time. Speaking of Elizabeth, she is perhaps the best FPS ally I have ever seen. Instead of just complaining and dying she actually makes herself usefull by always keeping a lookout for anything you might need. Just as you run out of ammo she is right there ready to toss you a full loaded carbine.

Some would praise Bioshock Infinite for it´s original plot line. At least it tries to be very original.  But if you see the twists miles away, then you will more like be bored with all the drama around it. Bioshock Infinite will give you little choice on any major decisions and the ones you can decide, dont really a matter. It's actually quite disturbing to be able to decide some things and be just a mindless puppet in others.

All and all Bioshock Infinite is a very solid FPS; easily better than most, but is is not something to get too hyped about. Something like 8,7/10.
